name: Rosewood Crescent Hotel

reviews.text: I stayed here one night for business. This is a large luxury hotel that brings to mind the Fairmont chain of hotels - similar style (and probably price). My room was large and had a very comfortable king sized bed, good quality linens and materials, and nice furnishings. The decor was elegant but not over the top. The bathroom was a bit small, and both the sink and bathtub drained very slowly and were in serious need of Liquid Plumber... The showerhead was unique and allowed water to come down straight at you. The service was quite good, with a nice mixture of professionalism and Texas hospitality. There is a branch of Nobu in the hotel, which tells you all you need to know about its price range. The hotel is located on the east side of downtown.
reviews.title: Nice hotel if you're on an expense account

reviews.text: I have stayed at the Crescent Court hotel several times and overall really enjoy the experience. Some of the rooms are really great, but I will review the room from my last stay, in Room 522:
reviews.title: Fabulous Service As Usual

reviews.text: King Size comfortable bed with great linens and pillows. Nice flat screen TV and spacious room area, but would have loved to have a coffee maker in the room so I could heat water for tea in the evenings.
reviews.title: Okay, but over-priced and needs renovation

reviews.text: Bathroom is large and very nice except that water pressure for the shower could be better. The Lady Primrose bath products are ok, not my favorites but nice large sized bottles at least. Loved the dressing/makeup area with cushioned bench, if I could purchase that and take it home I would, the lighting is really perfect and it's nicely designed.
reviews.title: Cotton Bowl Amazing !

likes.disliked: — a bit pricy but worth it

reviews.title: Beautiful hotel, but customer service needs improvement
reviews.text: Room service was excellent food at an incredibly inflated price. Seriously, crazy expensive, more than I am used to at other high end hotels. Luckily, there is a Starbucks downstairs and an Au Bon Pain across the way in the 200 building, plus many great restaurants nearby for lunch/dinners.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I stayed at the Crescent Court on February 1, 2008. The hotel is located in the Uptown Arts District. We had dinner at Nobu, a Japanese restaurant located within the hotel. At Nobu, we recommend the Omasake “chef’s tasting menu”. At $95 per person, we enjoyed 9 courses, each presented with a description on the chef’s preparation. If Japanese cuisine is not to your liking, then located adjacent to the hotel is The Capital Grille. Across the street are Truluck’s Seafood restaurant and Bice, an Italian restaurant. There’s a Starbucks located in the corner of the Crescent Court. Within a mile or so is Rosewood’s famous Mansion on Turtle Creek and the new Ritz-Carlton with Dean Ferring’s signature restaurant, voted best new restaurant of 2007 by Esquire Magazine.
reviews.title: Excellent Guest Experience

reviews.text: We had booked a standard guest room, #445, at $320/night. Parking was additional at $20/night. When we pulled up to the Crescent valets attacked the car, check-in was a snap, and bellman were right there to wisk us up to our guest room. Although a small guest room, it was nicely appointed, similar to The Mansion on Turtle Creek, and as nice as many Four Seasons or Ritz-Carltons.
reviews.title: Very Good hotel

likes.liked: — the pool, the staff and the location
likes.disliked: — restaurant, a/c set on arctic setting and drunken wedding scene

reviews.text: My wife said the spa was great. She had a Swedish massage and a facial and said the therapists were outstanding. LaGina was her massage therapist, and only works on Saturdays. She’s been at the Crescent for 8 years. My wife recommends that you request LaGina if you are there on a Saturday.
reviews.title: Great place in Dallas

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We live in the area, about 45 minutes away, so we like to get away to Dallas every now and then. We’ve stayed at The Mansion, The Adolphus with dinner in the French Room, and the Crescent Court. We’ve had dinner at Dean Ferring’s, and perhaps we’ll return for a stay at the Ritz-Carlton and another dinner at Ferring’s. I recommend that you compare pricing between the Mansion, Ritz-Carlton and the Crescent Court. They are all very nice.
reviews.title: Perfect Weekend!!!

reviews.text: I hope this review is helpful.
reviews.title: This Hotel Has Gone Downhill

reviews.text: I stayed at the Rosewood in Dallas for 3 nights for a work function. We utilized their meeting rooms and banquet facilities. We had an in-house dinner over at the Crescent Club. The food was excellent and I highly recommend the Crescent Club facilities. I stayed in a Suite (400) and the room was huge. Large living room with wet bar and flat screen TV, nice bedroom, great furnishings, bed was super comfortable. There were 2 bathrooms, the master was large, but I was disappointed with the tub/shower combo. I think a suite of that caliber should have a stand alone shower. The shower head was wonderful, double heads. They had large re-fillable shampoo/shower gels, however, they had a "conditioning shampoo" versus separate shampoo and conditioner. All pretty minor things, but I think important details when a hotel is trying to set itself apart. The location of suite 400 is not ideal, its on the back part of the hotel next to the loading dock, so there's a lot of noise early in the morning.
reviews.title: Great Boutique Hotel
top 5 star service
reviews.text: The pool was excellent, small, but very nice. I did not use the spa, but they had some great "day of" deals. All in all, a very good experience. I would definitely stay there again, both for personal or business.
very pretty hotel, with best staff service I had in the entire USA. friendly, attentive,helpfull, professional.
reviews.title: Solid Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: well designed rooms and bathrooms. recommendable with no doubt.
reviews.title: Very nice hotel and spa. Excellent service!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Had a meeting in Dallas so just stayed for a night. The hotel is beautiful and clean, nothing really unique about it, but does the job. I'd say a standard 4-star hotel. The lobby is nice and the hotel itself is very big. We went to the restaurant connected to the lobby for drinks and it was expensive but also quite fancy. The restaurant itself was very trendy.
reviews.title: Great Service

reviews.text: i am one of the pickiest travelers, especially when it comes to cleanliness. to be honest with you, i have no idea where all of these negative reviews could possibly come from?!?! (unless these are just people who are never pleased?) i absolutely loved the crescent. the staff is INCREDIBLE. they are soo accommodating, friendly, pleasant, and eager to help with anything. they quickly strike up conversations.
reviews.title: picky traveler who absolutely loved it!

reviews.text: i stayed in a room with a king size bed and it was pretty comfortable to me. the room had a marble bathroom, very nice showerhead, lighted vanity area, bathrobes (that were changed daily), slippers, flat-screen tv, desk, turn-down service at night, fresh water bottles daily, small "balcony" (which was really just a door that opened into the courtyard...not anything that you could go out and stand on BUT some fresh air is better than nothing!) and other amenities. no, it is not the biggest room in the world but it is definitely not small...there was a nice size area at the foot of the bed where the desk and chairs where situated. i would say it is slightly larger than a standard size room, especially for a city hotel.
reviews.title: Nice but ...

reviews.text: there are quite a few restaurants located within walking distance. most are pricey but the food is excellent. sammy's is great for bbq and is not far. also, for burgers, sandwiches, and salads...go to the stoneleigh hotel's restaurant which is located directly across the street from the hotel. the crescent has fabulous food in all of its facilities.
reviews.title: Our backs are still hurting

reviews.text: connected to the crescent is 'stanley korshak' which is a very upscale outdoor/indoor (outdoor escalators and stores that you entered from the outdoors) shopping area. there was a salon in here which was quite convenient in getting our hair done for the wedding we went to (but my poor sister went to chad and he styled her hair so terribly that another stylist actually redid it....so stay away from him). the shops here are super high-end, far more than a typical bloomingdales or neiman marcus but it's always fun to look!
reviews.title: Disappointing-Better as a memory.

reviews.text: the hotel was decorated beautifully for Christmas, with a very elaborate meringue display in the lobby as well as with lighted trees and giant wreathes throughout the grounds. i did not have time to visit the spa because i was there for a wedding but i was told by others in my party who frequent spas regularly, that it was incredible as well.
reviews.title: Such authentic, kind service!
DIsmal Hoitel
reviews.text: Hotel is managed by Rosewood which does a good job at its Cabo property but this one needs serious improvement.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Where do I begin?
reviews.title: Great place, but could use updating!
Flawless Hotel!
reviews.text: 1/ Service, average to poor with a significant snobbish character.
2/ Rooms, borderline dirty and smelled of mold
reviews.title: Good for business - Look out for Celebs!
Romantic and beautiful
reviews.text: 3/ Common grounds appear nice but don't look to close.

I stayed on business for two evenings and from check-in to check-out came across the some of the most professional and helpful staff I've ever encountered. There were no rooms ready upon check-in and yet the front desk person made several calls, upgraded my room, and made sure I did not have much of a wait. Additionally, she apologized for the wait - a real rarity and very much appreciated. Everything I requested, including a fan (yes crazy, but helps me sleep through the evening), they were able to meet. The valet and room service were always prompt. I took two early morning classes in the gym and both instructors were wonderful - I believe their names were Josh and Nikki. They were very helpful, patient, and great in explaining everything. The gym was large, very clean, and modern. I didn't encounter the thin wall issue (whcih is often tough) but I was upgraded to one of the top floor rooms which was very large. This is a wonderful hotel which I highly recommend.
reviews.title: Amazing service

reviews.text: Hotel looks great. BUT...walls are so thin. You will hear everything! When promised to have your room changed you can be assured that no employee will look you in the eye again. This might not be all rooms. Spa was nice and the employees treated my family great in the spa. The hotel is in a great location.
reviews.title: Walls are paper thin…so it’s great if you love to wake up early and listen to your neighbors talk about eyebrows or be k

reviews.text: The gym is excellent.
reviews.title: Good Hotel

reviews.text: The spa is excellent.
reviews.title: Fantastic Hotel

reviews.text: Good food options within walking distance.
reviews.title: The most relaxing time I have had in a long time.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had a wonderfully perfect weekend! It was our anniversary and we wanted to get away without going to far. The service was so friendly and accommodating. The Spa was an escape and getaway. The rooms were nice and well appointed. So much to do right there in the area! Can't wait to go back!
reviews.title: A perfect weekend!!

reviews.text: This was our first stay at the Crescent Hotel. The hotel is lovely and the location is fabulous. The lobby is beautiful, very clean outdoor pool area, and nice grounds overall. Check in was quick and smooth and our deluxe room was large and very clean. Very comfy beds and nice quiet rooms. We had the continental breakfast delivered to our room and it was fine. Great shopping right outside the hotel and neighboring hotels are within walking distance for those in need of a night cap and change of scenery!
reviews.title: Great hotel, great location!

reviews.text: This was my second stay at the Crescent Court in Dallas. It is a bit pricey for Dallas ($350 the night I stayed), but worth it. It is located on the edge of the central business district and adjacent to an entertainment and restaurant corridor. Despite being so close to several busy streets, there is absolutely no street noise whatsoever. The interior is understated but decidedly upscale and elegant. Not flashy, but more "old money," like many of its clientele. Service is personal and first rate, as would be expected of a property of this caliber. Upon entering my room, I found a hand written note from the manager, plus a chocolate cowboy boot filled with candied pecans from the hotel kitchens. Nice touch.
reviews.title: Elegant Hotel

reviews.text: I stayed here for 2 nights during a business trip.This hotel is very comfortable-the rooms are spacious, the pool area is serene and the complex that the hotel is great- with great shops, Nobu and starbucks. I also loved the gym and spa.
reviews.title: excellent and convenient

reviews.text: My one complaint is that I didn't think the staff , especially the concierge, was very helpful or friendly..
reviews.title: Really very good indeed

reviews.text: The Crescent Court is a simple 4 star hotel with pretensions greater than it ability. The location is "good" -- for Dallas. The public areas are beautiful, but the rooms are absolutely no different, in ANY way, than what you would find at any chain business hotel like Marriott or Hilton. In fact, the rooms may be a bit worse.
reviews.title: A 4, not 5 star hotel

reviews.text: The rooms are already looking a bit dated, they do not have webtv, and the bathrooms are certainly not larger or more nicely finished than you would find in any hotel -- no separate shower stalls here. Another peculiarity is the fitness area and the restaurant. You either have room service or Nobu -- which although tasty is a bit odd for a large business hotel. The fitness center is part of the basement spa, and is only open during the spa's somewhat limited hours, until 7:00 p.m. or so, which is simply not late enough for business travellers. Bottom line -- you undoubtedly could be just as happy, if not happier, at any number of hotels in Dallas for less cost.
reviews.title: Disappointed with Service

reviews.text: I wanted to do something special for our wedding anniversary so I booked a room at the Crescent. The price was steeper than I would normally pay, but being a special occasion, I thought it would be worth it. Unfortunately, that was not the case.
reviews.title: Lovely Hotel & Very Helpful Staff!
Bad First Impression
reviews.text: I requested that flowers, a fruit basket, and a bottle of champagne be in our room at check in. I was assured that this was not an unusual request (all at my expense), and would be taken care of. When we arrived at the hotel, I asked the front desk if my special requests had been noted in the reservation and was told that nothing special had been noted. Told not to worry, that fresh flowers were placed in every room every day, and that the fruit basket and champagne would be on the way shortly.

description: Large, modern-style hotel comprised of ten types of Italian and Spanish marble.
